intro: Ayenia pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf ayenia, is a small flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Ayenia pusilla is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is often found in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
